TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TreeNodeEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the , , , , and events of the control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TreeNodeEventArgs class is used to store the event data that is passed to an event-handling method.
For a list of the initial property values for an instance of the TreeNodeEventArgs class, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs.%23ctor%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode%29>.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to populate a node dynamically using the TreeNodeEventArgs object that is passed to the event-handling method.
[!code-cs[TreeViewPopulateNodesFromClient#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_326_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[TreeViewPopulateNodesFromClient#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_326_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode node) cil managed

Docs.param: A that represents the current node when the event is raised.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the TreeNodeEventArgs constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs> class.
> [!NOTE] > The TreeNodeEventArgs constructor is used primarily by control developers when raising events.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs> class.
|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs.Node%2A>|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> contained in `node`.|

Docs.summary: Gets the node that raised the event.
Docs.value: A that represents the node that raised the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Node property to access the properties of the node that raised the event. The Node property returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object and is commonly used to determine the contents of the node, to modify the properties of the node, or to add child nodes dynamically.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Node property to determine the text value of an expanded node.
[!code-cs[TreeViewTreeNodeExpand#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_411_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[TreeViewTreeNodeExpand#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_411_1.aspx)]
